CatDescriptText: Mrs. Beanner Rogers, housewife, North Side and Johnny Starks, musician, Garfield, were part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, April 8, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "Do you think there will be a Third World War?  If so, what do you think will be the cause or causes?" Mrs. Beanner Rogers' answer reads: "I personally think there will be if the nations keep arguing between themselves.  And I think our country should withdraw the troops and stop messing in somebody else's affairs."  Johnny Starks' answer reads: "I think so, because of the condition of things.  The mills are not working and there is a lot of unemployment.  It usually takes a war to straighten out things."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Mrs. Beanner Rogers wearing plaid tweed coat, holding light colored gloves, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Johnny Starks wearing hat, eyeglasses, moustache, and zippered jacket, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
